intro: Scabiosa syriaca, commonly known as the Persian clover, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its clustered, pink or white flowers that resemble small clover blossoms. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy perennial in suitable climates. Scabiosa syriaca is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
